content.description: Climb crack straight up to a rest on the huge ledge. Continue straight up crack on good jugs to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack. Could use big cams.
content.location: The obvious crack 20ft right of the crack of despair.

content.description: Around the corner from the the main face of parking lot wall and past Crack of Despair. The climb is in the corner below the decent sized squared roof. The route goes up to the roof and follows the crack and then up and over the roof.
content.protection: Can be toproped. Also looks to have plenty places for gear.
content.location: Around the corner from the main face of the parking lot wall and past Crack of Despair. The climb is in the corner.

content.description: Tricky, sequential climbing on broken edges and finger slots leads up and slightly left to sharp, fragile looking flakes. From the rest ledge continue up the left facing corner, step right onto a ledge and pull the roof.
content.protection: This climb has been led but there is groundfall potential on the lower face. Mostly toproped.
content.location: 10ft right of Ross crack below the first left facing corner.

content.description: Around the corner from the main face, behind a large tree is an obvious strenuous finger/hand crack.

Located just beyond the right side of the Parking Lot Wall.  

Anyone willing to take a stab at an updated description?*
